image.altText: A woman fills out a ballot.

props.synopsis: Will the anti-salmon farming vote play a part? Will the concern over job losses in the salmon industry trump that? Will the major parties keep the independents at bay? Here are the key Tasmania's seats and what the experts are predicting.

title.children: Your guide to Tasmania's election seats

image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: Just 57 Tasmanian children are responsible for half of all youth crime in the state, data shows, with a senior police officer saying the "therapeutic" approach won't work for some kids.

title.children: 57 kids 'responsible' for half of youth crime across Tasmania, data shows

image.altText: People gathered in front of big ship

props.synopsis: Named after a famous Uruguayan actor, the brand new new ship by Tasmanian shipbuilder Incat is said to be the largest fully electric vessel ever built.

title.children: Tasmanian-built world's largest electric ferry launches

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: It's been debated for years but the fate of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium will soon be decided. Airlie Ward discusses the next crucial steps with reporter Josh Duggan.

title.children: TassieCast: It's crunch time for the proposed AFL stadium

image.altText: Indoor salmon farming facility with a series of tanks.

props.synopsis: In Canada, the government has committed to transition marine salmon farming near British Columbia to onshore operations by 2029. Tasmanian Greens want the state government to follow suit, but the salmon industry says it's a case of "voodoo economics".

title.children: Canada is banning ocean-based salmon farming. Could Tasmania do it?

image.altText: Woman holding plastic bottle near donation site

props.synopsis: Day one of Tasmania's long-awaited container refund scheme has kicked off. Eligible cans or bottles can now be deposited at one of 40 collection sites across the state for a refund price of 10 cents per container. And so far, the uptake has been "remarkable".

title.children: Tasmania's container refund scheme has started. What you need to know

props.synopsis: When it comes to potatoes, Tasmania punches above its weight, producing more than any other state. But do you know your Kennebec from your Dutch cream, or many of the other varieties in between?

title.children: In search of the best potato at Agfest

image.altText: ABC election expert Antony Green smiles at the camera with his hands clasped behind his back.

props.synopsis: Antony Green has covered every single state and federal election that I have been alive for. He makes it all seem effortless. But I know how hard he's worked to be ready for May 3.

title.children: I get to see the Antony Green that election coverage viewers don't

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a road.

props.synopsis: Brittany McDermott first saw the woman she will vote for on election day on a panel alongside politicians from the two major parties.

title.children: Australians like Brittany tell Your Say how they plan to vote today

image.altText: Footage of Cauchi running towards Amy Scott who is holding a gun

props.synopsis: In the first of five weeks of a coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing,  the court heard about the confusion around a possible second offender and concerns the centre's alarms were too loud for emergency services.

title.children: What was learnt about the Bondi stabbings in first week of inquest

image.altText: Vanya Gaberova looks into a bathroom mirror wearing glasses capable of recording video.

props.synopsis: Operating out of a rundown hotel in Norfolk, Russian spies known as "The Minions" and their ringleader who went by the codename "Jackie Chan" gathered information on targets of interest to Russia for years but after being caught they will soon be sentenced.

title.children: How Russian spies caught in a love triangle unleashed chaos in the UK

image.altText: A redheaded man with a cropped beard walks past a brick-walled building

props.synopsis: Prince Harry has lost his challenge over police protection despite his lawyer warning his "life is at stake".

title.children: Prince Harry wants 'reconciliation' but King Charles 'won't speak' to him

image.altText: Russell Brand (2)

props.synopsis: British actor and comedian Russell Brand has appeared in a London court to face charges of rape and sexual assault involving four women.

title.children: Russell Brand granted bail on rape and assault charges

image.altText: A man with slicked back blond hair standing with his lips pursed in red prison clothing

props.synopsis: Illinois man Joseph Czuba stabbed and killed Wadee Alfayoumi and knifed his mother Hanan Shaheen days after Israel began its war on Gaza in October 2023.

title.children: US man jailed for 53 years over Islamophobic killing of six-year-old boy

image.altText: A woman standing behind a microphone pointing with one finger up.

props.synopsis: The AfD, which is the second biggest force in German parliament, has been confirmed as 'extremists' by the country's intelligence agency.

title.children: Far-right party labelled 'extremist' by German spy agency

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Reduced to its simplest form, the jury in Erin Patterson's trial will have to decide whether a beef Wellington cooked in her kitchen represents a terrible accident, or the ultimate act of betrayal.

title.children: Were stale leftovers fished from Erin's bin a murder weapon, or terrible accident?

image.altText: Two men trail after a house that is in the process of being moved along a hill.

props.synopsis: A wave of dam building during the mid-20th century displaced dozens of towns, villages and First Nations communities. A public history project hopes to recover them.

title.children: These towns were drowned to make way for human progress

image.altText: A man holding a snake out in front of him.

props.synopsis: Scientists have used blood from an American man who injected himself with snake venom for years to create what they say is "the most broadly effective antivenom to date" — at least in mice.

title.children: US man's blood may be key to universal snakebite antivenom

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton shake hands ahead of ABC Debate.

props.synopsis: From injuring a camera operator with a wayward kick to denying falling off a stage, it has been an exhausting five weeks for the two men vying for Australia's top job.

title.children: The wild and wacky moments that shaped the federal election campaign

image.altText: A woman is running on a track, with the sun setting behind her.

props.synopsis: Telaya Blacksmith is facing a crossroads, to continue her Paralympic journey, or pursue Aussie Rules — she is one of several disabled women building a name in mainstream sport.

title.children: How these disabled women are changing the face of mainstream sport

image.altText: Justin Longmuir looks to his right during a Dockers AFL match.

props.synopsis: Justin Longmuir admits he and his players will be forced to do some soul searching after the humiliating 61-point thrashing handed out by the Saints on Friday night.

title.children: 'What did I get wrong?': Dockers coach Longmuir left searching for answers

image.altText: Dylan Brown speaks to Nicho Hynes after an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Nicho Hynes's professional but unspectacular leadership of the Sharks is the sort of role he's cut out for, but his early success made us think he was something else.

title.children: Hynes finds his peace as wandering NRL eyes turn elsewhere

image.altText: Female surfer speaking to media, smiling, prior to a surfing event

props.synopsis: Surfing legend Stephanie Gilmore has said the competitive fires are still burning as she prepares to return to the World Surf League this weekend on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Surfing legend Gilmore still driven to take on the world

image.altText: roberts hanson

props.synopsis: A One Nation staffer has denied receiving commissions for introducing farmers he met through a Senate inquiry to a Brisbane law firm.

title.children: One Nation staffer reported to corruption watchdog over referrals to law firm

image.altText: A blurry photo of a boat and water sprayed over it

props.synopsis: Four Australian activists were preparing to board the ship in Malta and journey to Gaza, which remains under an Israeli blockade, with food, medical supplies and others.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists say their ship was struck by drone fire off Malta

image.altText: Chaos unfolds at Sydney's Randwick Racecourse at the site where students were sitting exams for gifted students

props.synopsis: Parents say logistical issues became clear when they attempted to drop off their children sitting exams for selective schools and opportunity classes at Canterbury Park and Randwick Racecourses.

title.children: Riot squad called to control parents, students at Sydney exam sites

image.altText: An aerial view shows a large sinkhole that formed when a sinkhole that swallowed a truck and a man

props.synopsis: The sinkhole, which was caused by corroded sewerage pipes, was first discovered in February and is now at least 40 metres wide.

title.children: Body of Japanese driver swallowed by sinkhole recovered months later

props.synopsis: Wills was Labor heartland, but now the seat that belonged to Bob Hawke is squarely in the marginal column.

title.children: Why Melbourne’s inner north has Labor worried

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at Ali France's campaign headquarters

props.synopsis: The leaders of the major parties have been darting around the country while everyone is learning the wrong lessons from the 2019 election.

title.children: Anthony Albanese's final campaign blitz looks just like Scott Morrison's

image.altText: A sillouette of trump stands in front of the letters NPR

props.synopsis: The White House, in a social media posting announcing the order, says broadcasters PBS and NPR "receive millions from taxpayers to spread radical, woke propaganda disguised as 'news'".

title.children: Trump signs executive order cutting funding for public broadcasters

image.altText: A mournful woman closes her eyes as her heads tilts downwards.

props.synopsis: The mother of Mackenzie Anderson, 21, says she plans to push for reform in her daughter's name after the man who stabbed her 78 times will be eligible for parole in 13 years.

title.children: Mum's outrage over 'light' sentence handed to daughter's DV murderer

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob sits in a black dress with a white collar holding a guitar, smiling.

props.synopsis: While best known for 90s hits 'Supermodel' and 'I Kissed A Girl', Jill Sobule's career spanned three decades, 12 albums and more.

title.children: Jill Sobule, singer behind I Kissed A Girl and Supermodel, dead at 66

image.altText: A man stands in front of a railway level crossing

props.synopsis: A federal candidate for the Riverina is standing by his comments slamming voters on social media, in a since-deleted post.

title.children: Candidate labels voters in his electorate 'dumbest on this planet'

image.altText: graffiti sprayed on the walls of a western sydney mosque that read hamas albo and albo liar

props.synopsis: NSW Police confirms it is investigating a vandalism attack at the Rooty Hill Masjid after it was defaced with the words: "No migrants", "Hamas Albo", and "Albo liar".

title.children: 'Offensive graffiti' targeting PM, migrants appears at Sydney mosque

image.altText: Selfie of 16-year-old Pasawm Lyhym.

props.synopsis: A teenager who stabbed and killed a 16-year-old boy near a bus interchange in Melbourne's west two years ago will spend at least eight years behind bars.

title.children: Teen jailed over train station stabbing 'genuinely remorseful'
